question_text: Which of the following best describes twisted pair wiring?
answer_options: Two copper conductors running parallel in a straight line
Multiple pairs of wires twisted together to reduce interference
Fiber strands wrapped in protective cladding
A coaxial cable with a single copper core
correct_answer: Multiple pairs of wires twisted together to reduce interference
explanation: Twisted pair cables consist of pairs of wires twisted around each other to reduce electromagnetic interference and crosstalk.
